title: Cracking the Particle Code of the Universe by John Moffat
description:
Among the current books that celebrate the discovery of the
Higgs boson, Cracking the Particle Code of the Universe is
a rare objective treatment of the subject. The book is an
insider's behind-the-scenes look at the arcane, fascinating
world of theoretical and experimental particle physics
leading up to the recent discovery of a new boson. If the
new boson is indeed the Higgs particle, its discovery
represents an important milestone in the history of particle
physics. However, despite the pressure to award Nobel Prizes
to physicists associated with the Higgs boson, John Moffat
argues that there still remain important data analyses to be
performed before uncorking the champagne.

Cracking the Particle Code of the Universe
by John Moffat
Pages: 628
Format: EPUB
Language:EN
